description: A sub-sequence of related content elements

..\\traits\\trait_id.json.title: Globally Unique ID trait
..\\traits\\trait_id.json.description: A globally unique identifier of the content in the ANS repository.

..\\traits\\trait_subtype.json.title: Subtype or Template
..\\traits\\trait_subtype.json.description: A user-defined categorization method to supplement type. In Arc, this field is reserved for organization-defined purposes, such as selecting the PageBuilder template that should be used to render a document.

..\\traits\\trait_channel.json.title: Channel trait
..\\traits\\trait_channel.json.description: An optional list of output types for which this element should be visible

..\\traits\\trait_alignment.json.title: Alignment
..\\traits\\trait_alignment.json.description: A property used to determine horizontal positioning of a content element relative to the elements that immediately follow it in the element sequence.

..\\traits\\trait_additional_properties..title: Has additional properties
..\\traits\\trait_additional_properties..description: A grab-bag object for non-validatable data.

..\\traits\\trait_content_elements.json.title: A collection of content.
..\\traits\\trait_content_elements.json.description: Holds attributes of an ANS collection - a common parent to story and gallery objects.

..\\utils\\content_element.json.title: An element that can be listed as part of content elements
..\\utils\\content_element.json.description: An item that conforms to this schema can be rendered in a sequence

..\\traits\\trait_gallery_properties.jso.title: Has gallery properties
..\\traits\\trait_gallery_properties.jso.description: An object for overrides for images when images are used in a gallery. Example usage: Each image in a gallery may have the images own focal point overridden by the gallery.

..\\traits\\trait_focal_point.json.title: Focal Point
..\\traits\\trait_focal_point.json.description: Coordinates representing the 'visual center' of an image. The X axis is horizontal line and the Y axis the vertical line, with 0,0 being the LEFT, TOP of the image.

x.description: The coordinate point on the horizontal axis

y.description: The coordinate point on the vertical axis
